newsitem.title: FINLAND: Helsinki seen starting up on bullish cue from US.
newsitem.headline: Helsinki seen starting up on bullish cue from US.

text.p: Shares were seen opening higher on Wednesday after the Dow industrials climbed to another record close overnight and Nokia rose on Wall Street, brokers said.
"I don't expect buyers to be tearing stocks out of our hands, but we could see a half a percent rise (in the main indices) right at the start," one broker said. "There's a positive undertone."
Nokia alone would boost the index after rising to the equivalent of 459.50 markka in New York, more than 10 markka above its 449.00 home bourse close.
Brokers expected Nokia to stay firm ahead of its half-year earnings report next Monday.
